<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/27/study-concludes-lightning-fast-trading-cost-investors-48-billion-annually?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Slow and Steady Doesn't Win the HFT Race
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="An illustration of a computer running numbers quickly " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580166186.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="An illustration of a computer running numbers quickly " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1580166186.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We like to race Google Maps to turn that 13 minute walk into a brisk 11. But in the financial markets, high-frequency traders are scurrying to execute trades by margins of 0.000005 seconds. According to a <a href="https://www.fca.org.uk/publication/occasional-papers/occasional-paper-50.pdf?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">study</a> released yesterday by British regulators, that head-to-head could <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ultrafast-trading-costs-stock-investors-nearly-5-billion-a-year-study-says-11580126036?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cost investors</a> $4.8 billion annually, the WSJ reports. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let's start slow</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">High-frequency trading (HFT):</strong> using complex algorithms to execute trades in hyperspeed. It's been criticized for amplifying market swings and benefitting big traders.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Latency arbitrage:</strong> when high-frequency traders are able to profit from a split-second advantage in executing a particular trade. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to the study, latency arbitrage <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/6eba2a7a-4114-11ea-bdb5-169ba7be433d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">imposes</a> a $55,000 "tax" on every $1.3 billion traded. In the U.S. in 2018, traders made an estimated $1 billion off the NYSE and $862 million off the Nasdaq. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What it means</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Latency arbitrage can increase costs for investors. As experts told the Journal:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Investors are "less likely to post competitive price quotes for stocks, knowing that those quotes could get picked off by speedy traders."</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"That, in turn, means investors get slightly worse prices whenever they buy or sell shares."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The study's authors said latency arbitrage's costs are concentrated among larger investors and imperceptible to average households. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The profits are also skewed. Just six firms won over 80% of "races" (when firms compete to make a trade first) measured in the study.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The authors </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/27/latency-arbitrage-trading-costs-investors-5-billion-a-year-study.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> eliminating latency arbitrage could cut trading costs by 17%. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Not everyone is upset.</strong> Kirsten Wegner, CEO of an HFT lobbying group, said the paper seems to have a political agenda and latency arbitrage actually <em>helps</em> investors by reducing transaction costs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>You just read about companies quietly getting billions to the detriment of others, so you know what's coming next. Presidential candidates Sens. Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren want financial transaction taxes to slow down high-frequency trading.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/27/casper-loses-unicorn-status-ahead-ipo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pack Your Horns and Go
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of a Casper box dropping down next to a door " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3ohs4f03DhHsFLKFmE/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of a Casper box dropping down next to a door " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3ohs4f03DhHsFLKFmE/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Casper Sleep is no longer a unicorn. According to <a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1598674/000104746920000503/a2240508zs-1a.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new IPO docs</a>, the mattress startup would be valued at $768 million if it went public at the top of its price range. It was <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-casper-sleep-ipo/casper-ipo-valuation-dwindles-from-peak-of-1-billion-idUSKBN1ZQ15V?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worth $1.1 billion</a> last March. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Jargon alert: </strong></span><span>A "</span><span><a href="https://pitchbook.com/blog/what-is-a-unicorn?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=AW-Brand-Awareness-US&_bt=411388957357&_bk=unicorn%20startup&_bm=p&_bn=g&gclid=EAIaIQobChMI5MWF_qek5wIVDW6GCh1jFA9wEAAYASAAEgL41_D_BwE&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unicorn</a></span><span>" is a privately held company valued at $1 billion or more. The term was coined by venture capitalist Aileen Lee in 2013.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A company—such as Casper—that loses its $1 billion valuation is called an "undercorn." </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Casper was the most typical 2019 unicorn you've ever met. In the nine months ending Sept. 30 revenue <em>grew</em> really fast (up 20% to $312 million), but <em>losses</em> also widened (to $67 million). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As it prepares to IPO, Casper will have to convince investors it has a path to profitability. Because if not, we have two words smushed awkwardly together for you: WeWork. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the IPO market is starting to <a href="https://www.axios.com/ipo-casper-ppd-reynolds-wework-b9390bed-b03b-44f9-b964-5947491b1072.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heat up</a> with big offerings. Pantry staple Reynolds Consumer Products is hoping to raise $1.3 billion this week.  </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOURISM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/27/chinese-tourism-significantly-due-coronavirus-outbreak?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Chinese Tourism Is Canceled
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Canceled flights at Tianhe airport in Wuhan, China" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwMTU2OTE3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Canceled flights at Tianhe airport in Wuhan, China. LEO RAMIREZ/AFP via Getty Images.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than 80 people are dead, 56 million across China are on lockdown, and millions more are scared to leave home. The tourism industry is close to panic mode. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Lunar New Year holiday, which began last Saturday, is one of China's busiest shopping and travel periods. Except that's <a href="https://qz.com/1790775/coronavirus-has-struck-at-the-worst-time-for-chinese-tourism/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not happening</a> because of the spreading coronavirus. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last year, Chinese consumers </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-retail/china-lunar-new-year-retail-sales-rise-but-pace-slowest-in-years-idUSKCN1Q0019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent</a></span><span> ~$148 billion on retail and catering during the Lunar New Year week. Domestic tourism generated $74 billion across 415 million trips. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>China's movie industry earns about 10% of its annual revenue during this period.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But right now, airlines are refunding tickets, premieres are canceled, and rail and air travel on Saturday was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/deadly-infection-keeps-chinese-consumers-from-spending-11580048219?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">down 41%</a> annually.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Zoom out</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China's economy was slowing before the outbreak. If coronavirus isn't contained by March, GDP growth could slip below the symbolic 6% mark, experts said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, countries including Japan, Vietnam, and South Korea depend on a steady inflow of Chinese tourists. They spent ~$18 billion in Thailand last year, and yesterday, Thai stocks <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-26/thailand-s-economy-facing-damage-from-china-s-ban-on-group-tours?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a> the most since 2016.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKRUPTCY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/27/luckys-market-american-blue-ribbon-holdings-bar-louis-file-bankruptcy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Not a Good Day to Be a Lucky Blue Louie
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photo of Lucky's Market's produce department " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwMTY2NjA1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lucky's Market</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When our newsletter takes a trip to Wilmington, DE, it's not to grab a brew at Iron Hill. It's to report on the chains that filed for chapter 11 in U.S. Bankruptcy Court yesterday. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Lucky's Market</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not even backing from the largest supermarket chain in the country could <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/kroger-backed-luckys-farmers-market-files-for-bankruptcy-11580136545?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">save</a> Colorado-based specialty grocer Lucky's Market. Kroger bought a stake in the company almost four years ago, but said last December it expected to write down the value of its investment by $238 million. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The plan forward: </strong></span><span>Lucky's has already started to close 32 of its 39 stores. It's looking to sell at least some to discount grocer Aldi. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">American Blue Ribbon Holdings</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The owner of restaurant chains Bakers Square and Village Inn couldn't withstand an <a href="https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/financing/bakers-square-village-inn-owner-files-bankruptcy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">onslaught</a> from a) higher wages and b) competition from family dining spots like IHOP and Denny's. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Fun fact: </strong></span><span>30% of Bakers Square's sales are pies. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Bar Louie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your favorite strip mall burger joint <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/27/investing/bar-louie-bankruptcy-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed 38 stores</a> and arranged a sale to lenders. It expects to emerge from bankruptcy within three months. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/27/super-bowl-liv-poised-second-highest-secondary-market-tickets-prices?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
I LIV for This
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A chart of Super Bowl ticket prices over the last decade; 2020 tickets are listed as $7,733, the second highest price point since 2010" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>TicketIQ</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stay one step ahead of Darren Rovell with this chart from <a href="https://www.ticketiq.com/nfl/super-bowl-tickets?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TicketIQ</a>. It shows the average secondary market listing price of Super Bowl tickets over the last 10 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Key takeaways:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If the numbers hold, Super Bowl LIV between the Kansas City Chiefs and San Francisco 49ers will be the second most expensive secondary Super Bowl ticket of the decade. Only the 2015 Super Bowl would be more expensive (do you remember who played? Answer at the bottom of the newsletter). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>TicketIQ says that historically, secondary market tickets fall to their lowest average asking price a week before the game and on Super Bowl Sunday itself. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As of last night, the most expensive ticket costs $41,644 in The 72 Club. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you're gunning for The 72 Club but don't necessarily want to sell your house to get in, there are some creative options to explore. StubHub is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-21/stubhub-will-now-let-you-go-into-debt-to-nab-super-bowl-tickets?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partnering</a> with fintech company Affirm to offer payment plans for ticket buyers. Annual interest rates range from 10% to 30%. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In five short days, Americans will split into two distinct categories: 1) those watching the Super Bowl for the commercials and 2) liars. Ads during this year’s game sold out in November and cost up to $5.6 million per 30-second spot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week on Morning Brew’s weekly </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual </em></strong><strong style="color:#000">podcast</strong>, we tackle the business beast that is the National Football League. Our tour guide, famed NFL analyst and exec Michael Lombardi, will walk us through...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The sustainability of Super Bowl hype </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>International expansion</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Legalized sports betting</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And the biggest threats to profitability</span></li>
</ul>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe like to race Google Maps to turn that 13 minute walk into a brisk 11. But in the financial markets, high-frequency traders are scurrying to execute trades by margins of 0.000005 seconds. According to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.fca.org.uk/publication/occasional-papers/occasional-paper-50.pdf?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e released yesterday by British regulators, that head-to-head could \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ultrafast-trading-costs-stock-investors-nearly-5-billion-a-year-study-says-11580126036?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecost investors\u003c/a\u003e $4.8 billion annually, the WSJ reports. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet's start slow\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHigh-frequency trading (HFT):\u003c/strong\u003e using complex algorithms to execute trades in hyperspeed. It's been criticized for amplifying market swings and benefitting big traders.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLatency arbitrage:\u003c/strong\u003e when high-frequency traders are able to profit from a split-second advantage in executing a particular trade. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to the study, latency arbitrage \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/6eba2a7a-4114-11ea-bdb5-169ba7be433d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eimposes\u003c/a\u003e a $55,000 \"tax\" on every $1.3 billion traded. In the U.S. in 2018, traders made an estimated $1 billion off the NYSE and $862 million off the Nasdaq. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat it means\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLatency arbitrage can increase costs for investors. As experts told the Journal:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInvestors are \"less likely to post competitive price quotes for stocks, knowing that those quotes could get picked off by speedy traders.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"That, in turn, means investors get slightly worse prices whenever they buy or sell shares.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe study's authors said latency arbitrage's costs are concentrated among larger investors and imperceptible to average households. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe profits are also skewed. Just six firms won over 80% of \"races\" (when firms compete to make a trade first) measured in the study.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe authors \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/27/latency-arbitrage-trading-costs-investors-5-billion-a-year-study.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e eliminating latency arbitrage could cut trading costs by 17%. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNot everyone is upset.\u003c/strong\u003e Kirsten Wegner, CEO of an HFT lobbying group, said the paper seems to have a political agenda and latency arbitrage actually \u003cem\u003ehelps\u003c/em\u003e investors by reducing transaction costs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eYou just read about companies quietly getting billions to the detriment of others, so you know what's coming next. Presidential candidates Sens. Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren want financial transaction taxes to slow down high-frequency trading.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCasper Sleep is no longer a unicorn. According to \u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1598674/000104746920000503/a2240508zs-1a.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew IPO docs\u003c/a\u003e, the mattress startup would be valued at $768 million if it went public at the top of its price range. It was \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-casper-sleep-ipo/casper-ipo-valuation-dwindles-from-peak-of-1-billion-idUSKBN1ZQ15V?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworth $1.1 billion\u003c/a\u003e last March. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJargon alert: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://pitchbook.com/blog/what-is-a-unicorn?utm_source=google\u0026utm_medium=cpc\u0026utm_campaign=AW-Brand-Awareness-US\u0026_bt=411388957357\u0026_bk=unicorn%20startup\u0026_bm=p\u0026_bn=g\u0026gclid=EAIaIQobChMI5MWF_qek5wIVDW6GCh1jFA9wEAAYASAAEgL41_D_BwE\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunicorn\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\" is a privately held company valued at $1 billion or more. The term was coined by venture capitalist Aileen Lee in 2013.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA company—such as Casper—that loses its $1 billion valuation is called an \"undercorn.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eCasper was the most typical 2019 unicorn you've ever met. In the nine months ending Sept. 30 revenue \u003cem\u003egrew\u003c/em\u003e really fast (up 20% to $312 million), but \u003cem\u003elosses\u003c/em\u003e also widened (to $67 million). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs it prepares to IPO, Casper will have to convince investors it has a path to profitability. Because if not, we have two words smushed awkwardly together for you: WeWork. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe IPO market is starting to \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/ipo-casper-ppd-reynolds-wework-b9390bed-b03b-44f9-b964-5947491b1072.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheat up\u003c/a\u003e with big offerings. LEO RAMIREZ/AFP via Getty Images.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMore than 80 people are dead, 56 million across China are on lockdown, and millions more are scared to leave home. The tourism industry is close to panic mode. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Lunar New Year holiday, which began last Saturday, is one of China's busiest shopping and travel periods. Except that's \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1790775/coronavirus-has-struck-at-the-worst-time-for-chinese-tourism/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot happening\u003c/a\u003e because of the spreading coronavirus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast year, Chinese consumers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-retail/china-lunar-new-year-retail-sales-rise-but-pace-slowest-in-years-idUSKCN1Q0019?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espent\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e ~$148 billion on retail and catering during the Lunar New Year week. Domestic tourism generated $74 billion across 415 million trips. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChina's movie industry earns about 10% of its annual revenue during this period.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut right now, airlines are refunding tickets, premieres are canceled, and rail and air travel on Saturday was \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/deadly-infection-keeps-chinese-consumers-from-spending-11580048219?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edown 41%\u003c/a\u003e annually.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eZoom out\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChina's economy was slowing before the outbreak. If coronavirus isn't contained by March, GDP growth could slip below the symbolic 6% mark, experts said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeanwhile, countries including Japan, Vietnam, and South Korea depend on a steady inflow of Chinese tourists. They spent ~$18 billion in Thailand last year, and yesterday, Thai stocks \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-26/thailand-s-economy-facing-damage-from-china-s-ban-on-group-tours?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e the most since 2016.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen our newsletter takes a trip to Wilmington, DE, it's not to grab a brew at Iron Hill. It's to report on the chains that filed for chapter 11 in U.S. Bankruptcy Court yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLucky's Market\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot even backing from the largest supermarket chain in the country could \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/kroger-backed-luckys-farmers-market-files-for-bankruptcy-11580136545?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esave\u003c/a\u003e Colorado-based specialty grocer Lucky's Market. Kroger bought a stake in the company almost four years ago, but said last December it expected to write down the value of its investment by $238 million. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe plan forward: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLucky's has already started to close 32 of its 39 stores. It's looking to sell at least some to discount grocer Aldi. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAmerican Blue Ribbon Holdings\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe owner of restaurant chains Bakers Square and Village Inn couldn't withstand an \u003ca href=\"https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/financing/bakers-square-village-inn-owner-files-bankruptcy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonslaught\u003c/a\u003e from a) higher wages and b) competition from family dining spots like IHOP and Denny's. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFun fact: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e30% of Bakers Square's sales are pies. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBar Louie\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYour favorite strip mall burger joint \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/27/investing/bar-louie-bankruptcy-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosed 38 stores\u003c/a\u003e and arranged a sale to lenders. It expects to emerge from bankruptcy within three months. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Only the 2015 Super Bowl would be more expensive (do you remember who played? Answer at the bottom of the newsletter). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTicketIQ says that historically, secondary market tickets fall to their lowest average asking price a week before the game and on Super Bowl Sunday itself. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs of last night, the most expensive ticket costs $41,644 in The 72 Club. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you're gunning for The 72 Club but don't necessarily want to sell your house to get in, there are some creative options to explore.
